metadata.name: Crossing The Fog
metadata.description:
A woman is passing through a forested and foggy path in one of the villages in the north of Iran called Javaherdeh for her daily shopping.

According to the custom of Islamic clothes in Iran, especially in the villages, this woman wears a veil, which is a symbol of the veil and covering of a Muslim woman in Iran.

After the Islamic government came to power in 1978, women in Iran are facing many restrictions and mandatory hijab. 

Iranian women have made many efforts and struggles against these limits in recent years.


JPEG image
Edition: 1/1
Size 3000 * 4000 px
